availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William O. Murrell (Adair County, Kentucky, saddler)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky saddler. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah F. Garrett Murrell in Adair County, Kentucky, on January 28, 1857. Father of Robert L. Murrell and Nat G. Murrell. Sadler in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Adair County in 1850. Sadler in Adair County in 1860.Enslaved two people in Adair County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 1A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 181.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 4B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, White Oak, 131B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027, Adair County Marriages, p. 143.
"William O. Murrell (1825-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 89243297, accessed December 27, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89243297.
